translation: Where do you want to go?

translation: It was then that Ānanda reported to him, Now, I want to go see the Buddha.

translation: It was then that the elder Devadatta reported to Ānanda, saying, Ānanda!

translation: If you're certain, I'll stay with you for a little while, and I'll also want to consult Upagupta, so I'll go with you to the Buddha's place.

source_sentence: 爾時，提婆達多即至跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽之所，頂禮其足，却住一面，
translation: At that moment, Devadatta approached the place where Upagupta was staying. Having saluted him by bowing his forehead at his feet, he withdrew and remained off to one side.

source_sentence: 而白之言：「我今意欲往見於佛，唯願尊者慈愍聽許。」
translation: He said to him, Now, I want to go see the Buddha, so may Venerable Maitreya allow me to do so.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽報彼提婆達多，作如是言：「汝若知時，
translation: At that time, the venerable Upagupta replied to Devadatta in this way:

source_sentence: 往至佛所，為我通傳，頂禮佛足，問訊世尊，少病少惱，身安以不？
translation: He approached the Buddha and said to him, “O World-honored One, are you free from illness and afflictions? Are you at ease?” [and] greeted him by bowing down at his feet.

source_sentence: 起居輕利，行來化導，不損德也？
translation: Their arousal and abiding are light and sharp, and their conduct is to be transformed and guided, so they don't lose their virtue?

source_sentence: 身體氣力，勝常以不？」
translation: Is the vitality of the body superior to that of permanence?

source_sentence: 提婆達多報彼跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽，作如是言：「如尊者教，不敢違背。」
translation: Devadatta reported to the [mouthed*ye]seṭa saṃgha, saying, As the venerable teaches, I won't dare disobey it.

source_sentence: 遂即頂禮，圍遶三匝，辭退而去。
translation: He then bowed his head, circumambulated him three times, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難與彼長老提婆達多，二人相隨，發雪山下，往向佛所，到佛所已，
translation: Ānanda and that venerable elder Devadatta, accompanied by two companions, set out from the foothills of the Himalayas to approach the Buddha. Having approached him, they said:

source_sentence: 頭面禮足，却住一面。
translation: They bowed their heads and feet at each other’s feet and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 我昔求請如來出家，如來而不與我出家，如來今日可不見我得出家耳。」
translation: In the past, I begged the Tathāgata to leave home, but the Tathāgata didn't allow me to leave home; today, the Tathāgata won't see me leave home.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告提婆達多，作如是言：「提婆達多！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Devadatta and said, Devadatta!

source_sentence: 汝為何事而出家也？
translation: What's the reason you left home?

source_sentence: 願汝得已，莫有背也。」
translation: May you attain it, and don't turn away from it.

source_sentence: 世尊往昔，恒常教彼提婆達多為利益事，提婆達多今反投佛以為怨讎？」
translation: In the past, the Bhagavān always taught Devadatta to do things for his benefit, but now that Devadatta has turned against the Buddha as a grudge?

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: After he spoke these words, the Buddha addressed the monks and said this, You monks!

source_sentence: 非但今日我教彼人提婆達多為利益事，反為其人以我為怨。
translation: Not only did I teach that person Devadatta today for their benefit, but I made me the enemy of that person.

source_sentence: 過去世時，亦復如是，我教利益，反怨於我。」
translation: In a past life, it was likewise, when I taught benefits and became resentful of me.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！

translation: What is this matter?

source_sentence: 願為論說。」

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「我念往昔，久遠世時，於雪山下，有二頭鳥，
translation: At that time the Buddha said to the bhikṣus: I remember one day, long ago, in the distant past, there was a two-headed garuḍa at the foot of the Himalayan Mountains.

source_sentence: 同共一身，在於彼住。
translation: The same and the same body are abiding there.

source_sentence: 一頭名曰迦嘍嗏鳥，一名優波迦嘍嗏鳥。
translation: One head is called the kaṭika-puṇḍarīka bird, and one is called the upaka-puṇḍarīka bird.

source_sentence: 而彼二鳥，一頭若睡，一頭便覺。
translation: If one of those two birds were to sleep, the other would awaken.

translation: They'll all be freed from hunger and thirst.'

translation: The awakening head then didn't cause the sleeping head to awaken, and he didn't tell him, so he quietly ate that flower.

source_sentence: 其彼睡頭，於後覺時，腹中飽滿，咳噦氣出，即語彼頭作如是言：『汝於何處得此香美微妙飲食而噉食之？
translation: When he woke up later, his sleepy head was filled with hunger in his belly and coughed out. He said to the other head, “Where did you obtain this delicious food and drink that is fragrant and delicate?

translation: It will cause my body to be peacefully filled, and it will cause the sounds that I produce to be subtle.'

source_sentence: 彼頭報言：『汝睡眠時，此處去我頭邊不遠，有摩頭迦華果之樹，當於彼時，
translation: When you were asleep, not far from where I was lying, there was a tree with red lotus blossoms and fruit on top of it.

source_sentence: 一華墮落，在我頭邊。
translation: A flower fell down by my side.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，作如是念：「今我但當獨食此華，若入於腹，俱得色力，並除飢渴。」
translation: At the time, I thought, Now, I'll just eat this flower alone; if I enter my belly, they'll attain physical strength and be freed from hunger and thirst.

translation: That's why I didn't make you realize it at the time and didn't tell you, so I ate this flower.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼頭聞此語已，即生瞋恚嫌恨之心，作如是念：『其所得食，不語我知、不喚我覺，
translation: At that moment, having heard these words, the hair on his head became angry and hostile. He thought:

translation: He then ate it himself.

source_sentence: 若如此者，我從今後，所得飲食，我亦不喚彼覺語知。』
translation: If this is the case, then I'll obtain food and drink from now on, and I won't call that awakened person to know it.'

source_sentence: 而彼二頭，至於一時，遊行經歷，忽然值遇一箇毒華，便作是念：『我食此華，
translation: At one time the two heads were traveling together. Suddenly they came upon a poisonous flower and thought, “I am eating this flower.

translation: May I cause both heads to be taken and killed at the same time?'

source_sentence: 于時語彼迦嘍嗏言：『汝今睡眠，我當覺住。』
translation: He then said to Kātyāyana, 'Now that you're sleeping, I will awaken and abide.'

source_sentence: 時迦嘍嗏聞彼優波迦嘍嗏頭如是語已，便即睡眠。
translation: When Kātyāyana heard this, Upāsaka Kauṇḍinya's head said so, he went to sleep.

source_sentence: 其彼優波迦嘍嗏頭，尋食毒華。
translation: That Upaka grated on the top of his head and ate poisonous flowers.

source_sentence: 迦嘍嗏頭既睡覺已，咳噦氣出，於是即覺有此毒氣，而告彼頭作如是言：『汝向覺時，
translation: Having awakened, Kātyāyana’s hair stood on end and coughed out. Then he perceived this poisonous odor. He said to the hair, “Your hair is like this:

translation: What's the bad food that they eat?

source_sentence: 令我身體，不得安隱，命將欲死。
translation: My body won't be able to be at peace, and my life is about to die.

source_sentence: 又令我今語言麤澁，欲作音聲，障礙不利。』
translation: It also causes me to speak crudely now, wanting to make a sound that won't be an obstruction.'

source_sentence: 於是覺頭報彼頭言：『汝睡眠時，我食毒華，願令二頭，俱時取死。』
translation: He then woke up and reported to the other head, saying, 'When you sleep, I'll eat poisonous flowers while you sleep, wishing to cause two heads to both die at the same time.'

source_sentence: 於時彼頭，語別頭言：『汝所為者，一何太卒，云何乃作如是事也？』
translation: At the time, that head said to another head, 'What are you doing, why would you do such a thing?'

source_sentence: 「『汝於昔日睡眠時，　　我食妙華甘美味，
translation: 'In the past, when you were sleeping, I ate wonderful flowers and delicious food.

source_sentence: 其華風吹在我邊，　　汝反生此大瞋恚？
translation: The flowery wind blows at my side, so why would you become angry?

source_sentence: 凡是癡人願莫見，　　亦願莫聞癡共居，
translation: All those who are deluded wish not to see, And also wish not to hear. The deluded live together:

source_sentence: 與癡共居無利益，　　自損及以損他身。』」
translation: They live together with delusion for no benefit, harming themselves and harming others' bodies.'

source_sentence: 即說偈言：佛告諸比丘：「汝等若有心疑，彼時迦嘍嗏鳥，食美華者？
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, The Buddha told the monks, If you have any doubts in your minds, then what's the place where the garuḍa bird feeds on beautiful flowers?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: Don't make a different view, which is that it's self and body.

source_sentence: 彼時優波迦嘍嗏鳥，食毒華者，即此提婆達多是也。
translation: This is Devadatta, the bird that feeds on poisonous flowers at that time called Upaka.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，為作利益，反生瞋恚。
translation: At the time, I did it for their benefit and became angry in return.

translation: So it is now, too, because I teach for the benefit of others and instead use me as an enemy.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦既出家已，即於彼時，夏三月內，成就三通；
translation: At that time the elder wife Devadatta had renounced household life. So it was during the three months of summer at that time that she perfected the three supernatural knowledges.

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀，得成天眼；
translation: Maṇiruddha obtained the divine eye.

source_sentence: 長老跋涪婆，長老因耆，長老難提迦，此諸人等，證羅漢果；
translation: The elder Upagupta, the elder Indra and the elder Nandika realized the fruit of arhatship.

source_sentence: 阿難復得須陀洹果；
translation: Ānanda again attained the state of stream-enterer.

source_sentence: 提婆達多成就世間凡夫神通。
translation: Devadatta accomplishes the supernormal powers of worldly mortals.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦得羅漢果，或在樹林，或住在於空閑房室，或住露地，
translation: At that time the elder’s wife, Devadatta, who had obtained the fruit of arhatship, sometimes stayed in a tree-covered forest, sometimes in a quiet room, and sometimes in an open space.

source_sentence: 或住在於祇陀園林，晝夜三時，恒唱是言：「嗚呼快樂！
translation: Or they may live in the Jetavana grove, and at three o'clock during the day or night, they always chant this, Ahoy, happy!

source_sentence: (如是三稱)。」
translation: (Such are the three names.)

source_sentence: 爾時，眾多諸比丘等，詣向佛所，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, many monks and others went to the Buddha and said to him, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其彼長老婆提唎迦喬瞿彌子，不樂在於世尊法中，不喜不樂，恒常憶昔王位時事富貴之樂，
translation: That elder wife, daughter of Devadatta Gotama, did not delight in the teachings of the World-honored One. She neither liked them nor disliked them. She always recalled the pleasures of wealth and prosperity that she enjoyed at the time when she was a king.

source_sentence: 恒常憶念如此事故，或住樹下，或住空房，或在露地，三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂(如是三稱)！』」
translation: He always always remembers such an event, whether he's standing under a tree, in an empty room, or in the open air, and three times he calls out, 'Ahoy, joyous (three such names)!'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊喚一比丘而告之言：「汝來比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān summoned a monk and told him, Come, monks!

source_sentence: 當往詣彼婆提唎迦比丘之邊，而為我語，作如是言：『世尊喚汝。』」
translation: You must go to the side of that monk Bhadrika and speak for me, saying, 'The Bhagavān summoned you.'

source_sentence: 其彼比丘白言：「如教，不敢違也。」
translation: That monk said, As instructed, I won't dare disobey it.

source_sentence: 即往詣彼婆提唎迦長老之所到已告言：「婆提唎迦！
translation: He went to that place where the elder Bhadrika arrived and told him, Bhadrika!

source_sentence: 世尊喚汝。」
translation: The Bhagavān summoned you.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦聞彼語已，詣向佛所，到已頂禮，却住一面。
translation: At that time, having heard these words, the elder wife Devadatta approached the Buddha. Having arrived there, she bowed her head in respect and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告婆提唎迦，作如是言：「婆提唎迦！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Vātsīputrīka and said, Vātsīputrīka!

source_sentence: 汝實不樂於我法中行梵行不？
translation: Do you really not delight in practicing the holy life within my teachings?

source_sentence: 恒常憶昔王位樂不？
translation: Do you always remember the happiness of your former royal throne?

source_sentence: 由憶彼故，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂！
translation: Because of remembering them, they may be under a tree, in a quiet room, or in an open place, and at three times they sing, 'Ahoy, happy!'

source_sentence: 嗚呼快樂！』
translation: Aah! happy!'

source_sentence: 如是以不？」
translation: Is it like this?

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦而白佛言：「如是世尊！
translation: It was then that the elder wife Tiṣyaka said to the Buddha, So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是跋檀多！」
translation: Thus, Upananda!

source_sentence: 佛復告言：「汝見何利？
translation: Again, the Buddha told them, What benefit do you see?

source_sentence: 或在樹下，乃至三時唱如是言：『嗚呼快樂！
translation: Sometimes he's under a tree, or at three times he says, 'Ahoy, happy!'

source_sentence: 嗚呼快樂！』」
translation: Aah! happy!'

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the elder wife Tiṣyaka said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我昔在家，治於王位，剎利灌頂，七重牆壁，圍我宮殿，守護我等。
translation: Formerly when I was a householder, I ruled the throne and ascended the kṣatriya throne. Having been consecrated by the kṣatriyas, I was surrounded by seven walls that enclosed my palace and protected me.

source_sentence: 復有象軍，七重守護，復有馬軍，如是七重，復有車軍，及以步軍，皆各七重，
translation: There were also elephant armies, protected by the sevenfold army, horse armies, and chariot armies as well as infantry, each of which was made up of seven divisions.

source_sentence: 俱被鎧甲，手執戎仗，所謂弓箭刀槊矛楯，金剛大杵，及大鐵棒，矛鑹鐵輪，
translation: They all wore armor and battle-armor, carrying in their hands what they call “bows, arrows, swords, halberds, spears, shields, vajras, great pestles, big iron sticks, spears, lances, spokes, and iron wheels.

source_sentence: 三叉鉞斧，諸戎仗等，周匝遶我，牆外復有七重水壍。
translation: They surrounded me with a three-pronged axe, battlements, and other weapons. Beyond the wall there were seven more moats filled with water.

source_sentence: 如是守護，如是障蔽，猶於夜中，若聞諸聲，心生恐怖，不得安樂，身毛皆竪，
translation: He guards them in this way and obstructs them in the same way at night. If he hears any sound, his mind becomes frightened and unable to be at ease; his body hair stands on end all over his body.

source_sentence: 恒生慚愧，諸根變動。
translation: They constantly give rise to shame, and their faculties change.

source_sentence: 世尊我今，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，夜聞種種諸惡獸聲，無有恐怖，
translation: Bhagavān, I am now either at a foot of a tree, in a quiet room, or in an open space. At night I hear the voices of various dangerous animals without fear,

source_sentence: 身毛不竪，無有慚愧，諸根不變。
translation: Their bodies and hair don't stand on end, they have no shame, and their faculties don't change.

source_sentence: 是故我恒獨坐思惟，心作是念：『我今大得利益之事，今者世尊為我大師，
translation: Because of this, I always sat alone and thought to myself: Now that I have accomplished such great benefits, the World-honored One is my teacher.

source_sentence: 自覺說法，於彼法中，我得出家，行於梵行，多有禁戒，攝受於我，成妙行人。
translation: In that doctrine, I renounced the householder’s life and practiced austerity. There were many [monks] who upheld the precepts and took refuge in me, thus becoming a practitioner of marvelous conduct.

source_sentence: 我於今者，善得活命，善得命終。』
translation: Now, I'll be able to live well and die well.'

source_sentence: 是故世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我以往昔王位樂時及富貴時，比於今日出家之樂，坐空閑樂、覺觀之樂、寂定之樂、沙門等樂，
translation: World-Honored One, the happiness of my former royal throne as well as that of my wealth and prosperity is compared to the happiness of today’s renunciation. The bliss of sitting in a secluded place, the bliss of meditative absorption, the bliss of stillness and concentration, and the bliss of becoming a śramaṇa.

source_sentence: 憶念此故，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，知足少欲，從他乞食，身毛不竪，
translation: For this reason I remember that some of them may be living in a tree, some in a quiet room, or in an open space. They are content with few desires and beg for food from others. Their bodies have no hair on their bodies.

source_sentence: 猶如山鹿，心得自在，坐臥去住，無有障礙。
translation: They're like a mountain deer whose mind is at ease, and there's no obstruction between sitting, lying, going, or standing.

source_sentence: 三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂！』
translation: Three times, he called out, 'Ahoy, happy!'

translation: These are the three names.

source_sentence: 「我昔在於深宮裏，　　七重牆壁甚高峻，
translation: “In the past I was deep inside a palace, With seven walls that were very high and precipitous.

source_sentence: 嚴治樓櫓及却敵，　　并有七重隍塹等，
translation: They adorned the towers and enemy turrets, As well as the seven moats of the great city walls.

source_sentence: 軍眾宿衛執戎仗，　　無晝無夜守護我，
translation: My armies are always guarding me, carrying their battlefields; Day and night they protect me.

source_sentence: 如是種種自防守，　　身意猶故不安寧。
translation: Thus, they protect themselves in various ways, yet their bodies and minds are still unsettled.

source_sentence: 我今在於世尊前，　　無有一人守護我，
translation: I am now in the presence of the World-honored One. There is not a single person who can protect me.

source_sentence: 及以在於空閑處，　　或在樹下山林中，
translation: It's in a quiet place, Or at the foot of a tree or in a mountain forest.

source_sentence: 如我佛子婆提迦，　　諸人各各相守護，
translation: Like my Buddha-child Bhadrika, Each of them protects the other.

source_sentence: 行住坐臥常安樂，　　是故心無有攀緣。
translation: Walking, standing, sitting, and lying are always peaceful; therefore, the mind has no objects to cling to.

source_sentence: 我昔宮內乘大象，　　身著繒綵上妙衣，
translation: In the past I rode a great elephant in the palace, My body wearing silk cloth and exquisite clothes.

source_sentence: 食噉粳粮甘美飯，　　羹臛調和肉味等。
translation: They eat rice, millet, sweet rice, soups, cooked meats, and other delicacies.

source_sentence: 今者坐臥隨意鋪，　　空閑身著糞掃衣，
translation: Now he's sitting or lying on a bed as he wishes, wearing a dust-covered robe in an empty place.

source_sentence: 捨愛拔除苦根本，　　欲有所行隨我意。」
translation: Rejecting craving and removing the root of suffering, I want to do whatever I want.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦在於佛前，對諸大眾，而說偈言：爾時，世尊因此事故，
translation: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra, who was seated before the Buddha, addressed the great assembly of bhikṣus and said in verse: The World-honored One, at that very moment, on account of this matter,

source_sentence: 「若人知命不生惱，　　亦即不憂是命終，
translation: “If someone knows that life doesn’t give rise to anguish, and they also don’t grieve when their life ends,

source_sentence: 若能勇猛見真諦，　　雖墮苦海終無怖。
translation: If someone can boldly see the true truth, they'll fall into the ocean of suffering but never have fear.

source_sentence: 已斷有愛比丘等，　　於一切物悉已斷，
translation: Having cut off craving, monks and so forth, They have cut off all things.

source_sentence: 生死煩惱皆滅盡，　　如是無復有後有。」
translation: The afflictions of birth-and-death have all ceased, and thus there's no more subsequent existence.

source_sentence: 復說偈言：爾時，世尊告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: Again, he spoke in verse, saying, At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the monks and said, You monks!

source_sentence: 若知於我聲聞弟子豪貴之中，捨家出家最第一者，所謂即此婆提唎迦比丘是也。」
translation: If someone knows that among my śrāvaka disciples, the most noble and renounces the householder's life, this is the so-called monk Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the monks said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老婆提唎迦，往於昔日，造何善根？
translation: In the past, what roots of goodness did this elder wife Devadatta create?

source_sentence: 今生釋種大豪貴家，乃至多饒資財產業，無所乏少。
translation: Now he's born in a great noble family of the Śākya clan, which has plenty of possessions and property, and there's nothing to lack.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What's the action that's also done?

source_sentence: 承繼釋種，得昇王位。
translation: He succeeded the Śākya clan and ascended to the throne of kingship.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What's the action that's also done?

source_sentence: 便得出家，受具足戒，獲羅漢果。
translation: He then left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of arhatship.

source_sentence: 世尊復記：『汝諸比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān again wrote, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 若於聲聞弟子之中，捨彼豪望而出家者，婆提唎迦最為第一。』」
translation: If someone among śrāvaka disciples abandons their noble aspirations and leaves home, the Bhadrika is the best.'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘僧作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks and said, You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔久遠之時，有一貧人，以乞自活，從一城至波羅[木*奈]城。
translation: I remember that in the distant past, a long time ago, there was a poor man who went from one city to Vārāṇasī on his way of subsistence by beggars.

source_sentence: 至彼城已，其城所有乞人見者，皆呵責言：『汝從何來，而至於此？』
translation: When he arrived at that city, all the beggars in that city who saw him rebuked him, saying, 'Where did you come from and come here?'

source_sentence: 遂遮不聽遊行告乞。
translation: He then stopped listening, traveled, and begged for alms.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼人見有障礙，作是思惟：『我於彼輩，無有過失，何故障我而乞告也？』
translation: At the time, that person saw an obstruction and thought, 'There's nothing wrong with me among those people, so why would I trouble myself and beg to be told?'

source_sentence: 於時波羅[木*奈]城有一長者，遺失銅鉢，時彼長者求覓銅鉢，所在不獲，
translation: At that time in the city of Benares there was an elderly man who had lost his copper bowl. The elderly man asked for a copper bowl but he could not find it.

source_sentence: 因求鉢故，至餘一村。
translation: Because he asked for a bowl, he went to another village.

source_sentence: 時彼乞人，於糞聚中，得彼銅鉢，掛於杖頭，將來往入波羅[木*奈]城，
translation: The beggar then found the copper bowl in a pile of excrement, hung it on the top of his staff, and was about to enter the city of Benares.

source_sentence: 從街至街，從巷至巷，從此交巷至彼交巷，從此隅角至彼隅角，口唱是言：『此之銅鉢，
translation: From streets to streets, from lanes to lanes, from this intersection to that intersection, and from one corner to the other corner, he said these words:

source_sentence: 是誰之物？
translation: Whose property is this?

source_sentence: 識者收取。』
translation: Consciousness collects it.'

source_sentence: 而彼遊歷處處東西，求覓其主了不能得。
translation: They traveled east and west, searching for their master but could not find him.

source_sentence: 既不得主，便即往至付梵德王。
translation: When he didn't get the master, he went to King Brahmadeva and handed it over to him.

source_sentence: 乃至長者後聞有人從彼糞中，得一銅鉢，掛於杖頭，將來入彼波羅[木*奈]城，
translation: The wealthy man then heard that someone had obtained a copper bowl from the dung, hung it on the top of his staff, and was about to enter the city of Benares.

source_sentence: 從街至街，從巷至巷，而口唱言：『是誰銅鉢？』
translation: From street to street, from street to street, and from street to street, he says, 'Who's the copper bowl?'

source_sentence: 處處遊訪，不知主處，既不得主，便付梵德。
translation: He traveled from place to place, didn't know where the master was, and because he couldn't get the master, he entrusted it to Brahmā.

source_sentence: 既聞是已，到梵德邊，到已白言：『大王！
translation: Having heard this, he went to the side of Brahmadeva and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，前者乞人，所奉銅鉢，是我之物。』
translation: You should know that the preceding beggar's bronze bowl presented to him is mine.'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王遣使往喚彼之乞人，而語之言：『汝於前者，所送銅鉢，
translation: Then King Brahmadeva sent an envoy to summon the beggar and said to him:

source_sentence: 今此長者云是我許，其事如何？』
translation: Now, this wealthy man says, 'I approve, what's the matter?'

source_sentence: 彼人即白梵德王言：『如是大王！
translation: That man then said to King Brahmadeva, 'So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 我本不知彼之銅鉢是誰之物？
translation: Originally, I didn't know whose property that copper bowl was.

source_sentence: 在糞聚中，我既得已，即掛杖頭，將來往入波羅[木*奈]城，東西訪問不知主處，
translation: In the midst of a mass of excrement, I got it. Having obtained it, I hung up my staff and approached the city of Benares but did not know where to go.

source_sentence: 以不得主，遂即將來奉與大王，任王所用。』
translation: Because he didn't get the master, he then presented it to the king and let him use it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德聞彼語已，心大歡喜，而告彼言：『仁者！
translation: Having heard these words, the brahmin was greatly delighted and said to them:

source_sentence: 汝今欲於我邊乞何等願？
translation: What kind of vow do you want to ask me now?

source_sentence: 我當與汝。
translation: I will give it to you.

source_sentence: 而彼銅鉢，還其長者。』
translation: That copper bowl returns to the elder.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼人白梵德王，作如是言：『大王！
translation: At the time, that man said to King Brahmadeva, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今若必欲歡喜與我願者，願王於此波羅[木*奈]城，所有乞人，用我為王。』
translation: Now, if you must rejoice and give me my wishes, may the king use me as king for all the beggars in this [munai] city of Vārāṇasī.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，復告彼言：『今者何用與彼乞兒而為王也？
translation: King Brahmadeva then again addressed them, saying, 'Now, why would you give that beggar to the king?'

source_sentence: 但當更乞諸餘好願，或金或銀，或索國中最勝村落，用為封邑，我即與汝。』
translation: But you must also beg for the other good wishes, whether gold or silver, or ask for the most excellent village in the country to be used as a feudal fief, and I'll give it to you.'

source_sentence: 時彼乞人，復白王言：『王若歡喜，與我願者，我今止欲得前所願。』
translation: The beggar then again said to the king, 'If the king rejoices and grants me my vow, I'll stop wanting to get what I previously wished.'

source_sentence: 王遂報言：『任汝所樂，隨汝作耳。』
translation: The king then replied, 'I'll do as you please, according to your wishes.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，在彼波羅[木*奈]城，合有五百乞兒依住，彼乞願者，悉喚令集而告之言：『我今得與汝等為王，
translation: At that time, there were five hundred beggars living together in the city of Vārāṇasī. Those who wished to receive their support called assemblies and told them, “I am now able to make you kings.” The bhikṣus said:

source_sentence: 汝等必當聽我處分。』
translation: You must listen to the portion of my place.'

source_sentence: 時諸乞人問彼王言：『汝今云何處分我等？
translation: The beggars then asked the king, 'Now, where are you dividing us?'

source_sentence: 令作何事？』
translation: What's the thing that I want you to do?'

source_sentence: 時彼人言：『汝等相共，或有捉我置髆上者，或有取我而背負者，自餘皆悉為我左右，
translation: That man said to them, “Some of you are holding me in their hands and placing me on top of the carriage. Some of you are holding me upright and carrying me behind your backs. The others are all at my side.

source_sentence: 圍遶而行。』
translation: He's surrounded and walking.'

source_sentence: 而彼五百諸乞兒輩，聞彼語已，即從處分，或有輿者，或背負者，處處遊行，
translation: And the five hundred beggars, having heard these words, immediately departed from their places. Some of them were carrying a carriage, while others were traveling in various directions.

source_sentence: 所有飲食坐席之所，即往彼乞，乞已將向一處分張，而共食噉，如是方便多時活命。
translation: At the seat where he had food and drink to sit, he went there to solicit alms, begged for it, shared it with someone else, and ate together, thus maintaining his livelihood for a long time.

source_sentence: 「時，有一人屏處獨食摩呼荼迦(隋言歡喜丸)，爾時，乞王從其人邊，
translation: “At that time, there was a man sitting in seclusion eating the mahoraga (known as the joy-buds in the Sui language) alone.

source_sentence: 奪取彼食摩呼荼迦，奪已將走。
translation: Taking that food, he takes the mahoraga and walks away after taking it.

source_sentence: 其王徒眾五百乞兒，逐彼王走至於遠處，皆悉疲乏，既疲乏已，悉各迴還。
translation: The king's retinue of five hundred beggar children ran after the king and went to a distant place, all exhausted, and when they were exhausted, they each returned.

source_sentence: 其彼乞王，身力壯健，走而不乏，更至遠已，迴頭望看，五百乞兒，悉皆不見。
translation: The king begging for alms was so strong and strong that he could not run out of strength. When he reached the distant side, he turned his head around to look at the five hundred beggars but they all did not see him.

source_sentence: 既不見已，入一園內，取水洗手，坐於一邊，欲食彼食。
translation: Having not seen him, he entered one of the parks. He washed his hands with water, sat to one side, and wished to partake of that food.

source_sentence: 未食之間，便生悔心：『我今不善。
translation: Before he ate, he became remorseful and said, 'Now, I'm unwholesome.

source_sentence: 我今何故，於彼人邊，奪取其食？
translation: Why am I now taking food from that man's side?

source_sentence: 更復誑我隨從人輩？
translation: Again, why would you deceive me into following the people?

source_sentence: 此食既多，我食不盡。
translation: Since this food is plentiful, I won’t run out of food.

source_sentence: 若世間內有諸聖人，願知我意而來此者，我即分與。』
translation: If there are sages in the world who wish to know my intention and come here, I'll give them to them.'

source_sentence: 發是心已，有辟支佛，名曰善賢，從虛空裏飛騰而來，在彼人前，從空直下，
translation: Having aroused this aspiration, there was a pratyekabuddha named Shanxian who came up from the sky and flew straight down in front of them.

source_sentence: 去其不遠。
translation: It's not far from them.

source_sentence: 其人遙見彼辟支佛，威儀庠序，行步齊停，舉動得所，不緩不急，見如是已，
translation: From a distance the man saw the pratyekabuddha’s dignified demeanor and manner. He walked up and down one step at a time, reaching his destination without moving or galloping. Having seen it in this way, he said:

source_sentence: 於彼辟支，心得淨信。
translation: They attain pure faith in those pratyekabuddhas.

source_sentence: 得淨心已，作如是念：『由我往昔所受貧賤，及以現在，皆悉不值如是福田，
translation: Having attained purity of mind, he thought: In the past and in the present neither I have ever experienced poverty nor will I attain such a field of blessedness.

source_sentence: 於如是人，不行布施恭敬供養；
translation: To such a person they do not practice generosity, reverence, and offerings.

source_sentence: 我昔若值如是福田，今日應不遭斯困頓，亦應不被他人逼切而得活命。
translation: If I had found such a field of merit in the past, I wouldn't have been trapped today, and I wouldn't have been oppressed by others to attain my livelihood.

source_sentence: 我今將此摩呼荼食，奉上仙人，未審此仙受納已不？
translation: Now, I'll take this food of the mahorada and offer it to the superior sage, but I wonder if he has accepted it?

source_sentence: 若蒙受者，願我將來免此貧賤困厄之身。』
translation: If someone receives it, may I be freed from this poor and distressed body in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即將此食摩呼荼迦，奉此仙人。
translation: After he had this thought, he gave this food to the sage Mahākauṣṭhila and offered it to him.

source_sentence: 然辟支佛，有如是法，唯現神通，教化眾生，更無別法。
translation: But the pratyekabuddhas have this doctrine: They only manifest their supernormal powers to edify sentient beings. There is no other doctrine apart from this.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，受取彼食摩呼荼迦，愍斯人故，從彼地方，騰空而去。
translation: The pratyekabuddha then accepted that food and took the mahoraga, and because of these people, he rose up into the sky from that place and departed.

source_sentence: 其人見彼辟支世尊騰空去已，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，以歡喜心，
translation: Having seen the World-honored One, the pratyekabuddha rose up into the sky and departed, they all rejoiced and jumped for joy. Filling their bodies with joy, they were unable to control themselves.

source_sentence: 頂戴指掌，遙禮彼尊辟支佛足，作是禮已，心發是願：『願我此身，於未來世，
translation: He put his palms together at the top of his head and bowed to the feet of that venerable pratyekabuddha from a distance. After having done so, he made this vow:

source_sentence: 恒常值遇如是世尊，或勝此者，而彼世尊所說之法，願我一聞速得證解。
translation: I'll always meet such a Bhagavān, or someone who's superior to this one, and may I quickly realize the teaching taught by that Bhagavān as soon as I hear it.

source_sentence: 又願我於未來世中，在大威德豪族姓家，為王治化，更莫在彼貧兒之內。』
translation: May I also wish that in a future life, I'll be governed and transformed by a great family of great power and virtue for the king, so that I won't be among those poor children.'

source_sentence: 復作是願：『生生世世，不墮惡道。』」
translation: Again, he makes this vow: 'Birth and birth in the world won't fall into a bad path.'

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks and said, You monks!

source_sentence: 若有心疑，於彼之時，波羅[木*奈]城，乞兒之王，施辟支佛摩呼荼迦，
translation: If there is any doubt in one’s mind, at that time the king of beggars who live in the city of Benares will give the pratyekabuddha mahoraga to the pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 此是誰者？
translation: Who is this?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，婆提唎迦比丘是也。
translation: Don't make any different views, for this is the monk Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 時乞兒王施辟支佛摩呼荼食，因彼業果，今生釋種，大豪貴族，乃至資財，
translation: The king of the begging children then gave food to the pratyekabuddhas, and as a result of that action, they were now born in the Śākya clan, a great noble family, up to the level of wealth.

source_sentence: 無所乏少。
translation: Nothing is lacking.

source_sentence: 復於彼時，作如是願：『願我來世，於大威德豪族種姓，為王教化。』
translation: Again, at that point, he made the following vow: 'May I in a future life teach and transform myself for the king among the greatly powerful and powerful castes of people.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，今於釋種，得受王位。
translation: As a result of that karmic retribution, he's now in the Śākyamuni family to receive the king's throne.

source_sentence: 又時乞願：『願我當來，生生世世，不墮惡道。』
translation: Again, he begged and vowed, 'May I be born in the future, not falling into a bad destiny.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，不曾生墮惡道之中，恒生人天，流轉往反，多受快樂。
translation: As a result of their karmic retribution, they won't ever be born in a bad destiny, always being born among humans and gods, going back and forth, and often experiencing happiness.

source_sentence: 又時復乞如是願言：『願我來世，恒值如是辟支世尊，或勝此者，彼之世尊所說經法，
translation: Again, in a future life I should always meet such a pratyekabuddha as the World-honored One, or one who surpasses him in this way. Such a pratyekabuddha teaches the doctrine of the scriptures taught by that world-honored one.

source_sentence: 願我聞已，速知速解。』
translation: May I hear it and quickly know and understand it.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，今值於我，而得出家，受具足戒，得羅漢果。
translation: Because of the karmic retribution of that action, it's now possible for me to leave home, receive the full set of precepts, and attain the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 我又授記：『於我聲聞弟子之中，豪姓出家最第一者，婆提唎迦比丘是也。』
translation: I also gave a prediction, saying, 'The most powerful among my śrāvaka disciples who renounced the householder's life was the monk Bhadrika.'

source_sentence: 「汝諸比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 婆提唎迦昔造如是善根因緣，以造如是善根因故，今生豪姓釋種之家，
translation: In the past, Vātsīputrīka created causes and conditions for such roots of goodness. Because he created causes and conditions for such roots of goodness, he is now born in a house belonging to the noble family of the Śākya clan.

source_sentence: 大富大貴，乃至資財無所乏少。
translation: He's greatly wealthy and valuable, even his possessions don't lack anything.

source_sentence: 於釋種中，得紹王位，捨其王位，而得出家，受具足戒得羅漢果，故我授記，
translation: Among the Śākya clan, he attained the throne of Shao (i.e., King Aśoka), renounced his royal throne, renounced domestic life, received higher ordination, and obtained the quality of arhatship. For this reason I predict:

source_sentence: 於我聲聞弟子之中，豪姓出家，婆提唎迦比丘第一。」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the monk Bhadrika, a noble family renunciant, is the best.

source_sentence: 其彼長老婆提唎迦，乃至已得阿羅漢果，恒住蘭若，乞食活命，著糞掃衣，
translation: That elder wife, Devadatta, up to the point where she had attained arhatship, always lived in Rājagṛha, begged for food to sustain her life, and wore robes made of rags.

source_sentence: 常坐不臥，隨宜鋪設，唯持三衣，更無畜積。
translation: He always sat and did not lie down, spread his outer robes as he wished. He wore only the three kinds of cloth and did not store anything else.

source_sentence: 至於一時，依住在彼舍婆提城，於阿蘭若樹林之內。
translation: At one time, he relied on living in the city of Śrāvastī and stayed inside the forest of Ārāṇya.

source_sentence: 時彼長老求覓諸草及以樹葉，了不能得，即時求覓乾白象糞，聚以為鋪，
translation: The elder then looked for some grass and leaves, but he couldn't find them. So he searched for dry white elephant dung and gathered it to make a bed.

source_sentence: 上鋪坐具，結加趺坐，端身正直，即得正念。
translation: He spreads out his sitting cloth on the bed and sits cross-legged, with his body straight and upright, attaining right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 過於一夜。
translation: It was more than a night later.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，於晨朝時，著衣持鉢，欲往入彼舍婆提城，往來乞食。
translation: It was then that the elder wife, Devadatta, put on her robes and bowl in the morning, wished to go into the city of Śrāvastī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，城內多有乞食諸人，乞得食已，從其城出，去城不遠，各各別欲食所得食。
translation: At the time, there were many people in the city who were begging for food. After they had obtained food, they came out of the city and went not far from it, each wanting to eat his own food that he had obtained.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，遙見如是諸乞食人從城乞食，既得彼食，去城不遠，
translation: At that time the elder’s wife, Devadatta, saw from a distance these beggars coming out of the city to solicit almsfood. Having obtained their food, she came not far from the city.

source_sentence: 別坐欲食，遂往彼邊，默然而住。
translation: They sat separately and wished to eat. So they went to the other side, remained silent, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸乞人等，作如是念：「此之比丘，必於我等，欲有憐愍，
translation: At the time, all the beggars and others had this thought, This monk must have pity for us.

source_sentence: 故來乞食。」
translation: That's why I came to beg for food.

source_sentence: 作是念已，各各自於所食之內，減取少分，與彼長老婆提唎迦。
translation: After they had this thought, each of them took a small portion of what they ate and gave it to their long-abiding wife Devadatta.

source_sentence: 爾時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，乘騎一大白象，其象名曰一分陀利，從其彼城舍婆提出，
translation: It was then that the king of Vāseṭṭṭha mounted a great white elephant named Puṣkarasārin and came out of that city from Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 共一大臣，其臣名曰尸利跋陀(隋言德賢)。
translation: Together, they had a minister named Śrīvardhana (known as Dexian in the Sui language).

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，遙見婆提唎迦從彼乞兒乞食而食，即告大臣尸利跋陀作如是言：「尸利跋陀！
translation: Seeing Bhadrika from a distance and begging for food from that beggar, the king of Prasenajit's country told his minister Śāriputra this, saying, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 此何比丘？
translation: What's this monk?

source_sentence: 乃從乞兒，乞食而喫。」
translation: He then ate from the beggar's food and begged for it.

source_sentence: 爾時，大臣審更熟看婆提唎迦，知是不虛，而白王言：「大王！
translation: Knowing that it wasn't false, the minister examined Bhadrika and said to the king, Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，此是釋王婆提唎迦。」
translation: You should know that this is the Śākyamuni King Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 其王即告彼大臣言：「若如此者，汝驅白象，向彼婆提唎迦之邊。」
translation: The king then told the minister, If that's the case, drive the white elephant away and go to the side of Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 尸利跋陀聞王勅已，而白王言：「如王教勅，不敢違也。」
translation: After hearing the king's command, Śāriputra said to the king, As the king commands, I won't dare disobey it.

source_sentence: 受王勅已，將此白象，王乘其上，詣向長老婆提迦邊。
translation: After receiving the king's command, he took this white elephant, and the king rode it up to the side of Changshuitika.

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，去彼婆提唎迦住處不遠，從其象上下，禮長老婆提唎迦，
translation: The king of that country Prasenajit, not far from the place where Vātsīputrīka lived, came down from his elephant and bowed to Vimalakīrti.

source_sentence: 禮彼足已，却住一面。
translation: After bowing his head at their feet, he withdrew and remained off to one side.

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國王，啟白長老婆提唎迦，作如是言：「阿梨耶！
translation: The king of Prasenajit then addressed the elder wife, Tiṣyaka, and said, Ariṣṭika!

source_sentence: 今者何故乃發如是貧賤之意，乃於如此貧人等邊，乞食而食？」
translation: Why is it that you give rise to such poor intentions now, begging for food and eating at the side of such poor people?

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，告波斯那憍薩羅王，作如是言：「大王！
translation: It was then that the elder wife, Devadatta, addressed King Prasenajit and said, Great king!

source_sentence: 我今不以貧故而從彼乞，我今自有七種寶財，但我意樂從於貧人而乞食耳，
translation: I am not begging for food from them because I am poor. Now that I have the seven kinds of treasure wealth, what I want is to beg for food from those who are poor.

source_sentence: 又欲令彼諸貧兒輩斷貧窮故，而從乞也。
translation: They also want to cause those poor children to end poverty and beg for it.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我已有眼，但欲為彼無明眾生開眼目故，而來從乞。
translation: You should know that I already have eyes, but I want to open my eyes for the sake of those ignorant sentient beings and come begging.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 我今已脫一切繫縛，但以為彼貪欲瞋恚所縛眾生得解脫故，而從乞食。
translation: Now that I'm free of all the bonds, I simply beg for food because I want to attain liberation for those sentient beings bound by desire and anger.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我今已度彼岸，但為拔脫煩惱淤泥所溺眾生，故從彼乞。
translation: Now that I've crossed the other shore, I simply want to remove the afflictions and muds that drown sentient beings who are submerged in it, so I beg from them.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 我已獲得無病之處，但欲治彼煩惱所病諸眾生故，而從彼乞。」
translation: I've already attained a place where there's no illness, but I want to treat the afflictions that are sick in sentient beings and beg from them.

source_sentence: 時波斯那憍薩羅國其王，復白婆提唎迦作如是言：「阿梨耶！
translation: The king of Prasenajit then again said to Bhadrika, saying, Ariṣṭika!

source_sentence: 我亦貧無七種財寶，我亦幽冥住於黑闇，我亦被於煩惱淤泥之所沈溺，
translation: I am also poor and do not possess the seven kinds of wealth. I dwell in darkness, being submerged in the mire of afflictions.

source_sentence: 我今亦有貪欲之病，願阿梨耶！
translation: Now, too, I'm sick of craving, so please, Ārya!

source_sentence: 憐愍我故，唯悕數數來至我家。」
translation: Because you're pitying me, you've only come to my house repeatedly.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，告波斯那憍薩羅王，作如是言：「大德大王！
translation: It was then that the elder wife, Devadatta, addressed King Prasenajit and said, Great king of virtue!

source_sentence: 不須如此。」
translation: It doesn't need to be like this.

source_sentence: 作是語已，捨王而去。
translation: After he said these words, he abandoned the king and departed.

translation: Fobenxing ji jing maniruddha pin fifty-nine above

source_sentence: 又時，世尊為諸比丘演說諸法，於時長老摩尼婁陀睡眠不覺。
translation: Again, when the Bhagavān explained the teachings for the monks, the elder Maṇiruddha was asleep and didn't awaken.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告摩尼婁陀，作如是言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Maṇiruddha and said, Maṇiruddha!

source_sentence: 汝何於此法義之內，如是睡眠，汝於此事，深為不善。
translation: Why do you sleep like this within the meaning of this doctrine? You are deeply unwholesome about this matter.

source_sentence: 汝起莫睡！」
translation: Go up and don't sleep!

source_sentence: 從此已後，摩尼婁陀更不睡臥，正以多時，不得睡故，壞其肉眼，唯以天眼，
translation: “After this, Māṇiruddha did not sleep or lie down. For a long time he could not sleep; so he destroyed his physical eyes with the help of divine vision.

source_sentence: 觀世間色。
translation: He observes worldly form.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, saying, You monks!

source_sentence: 於我聲聞諸弟子中，清淨梵行，最第一者，所謂摩尼婁陀是也。」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the purest and best of pure religious practices is what's called maniruddha.

source_sentence: 又於一時，摩尼婁陀數數縫綻諸衣裳等，又時五指總持五針。
translation: Again, at one time, Maṇiruddha repeatedly sewed his clothes and other things, and then he held five needles together with five fingers.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老大目揵連詣向其所，而語之言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: At that point, the elder Mahāmaudgalyāyana went to him and said, Maṇiruddha!

source_sentence: 汝今共我遊行去來。」
translation: Now, you're traveling with me to and fro.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀報目連言：「長老目連！
translation: It was then that the elder Maudgala reported to Maudgalyāyana, saying, Elder Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 且住且住！
translation: Just abide, and abide!

source_sentence: 待我衣成。」
translation: They'll wait until my robe is done.

source_sentence: 爾時，目連復語長老摩尼婁陀：「汝今若以神通縫者，願速成就，若以今意所欲成者，
translation: At that point, Maudgalyāyana again said to the elder Māṇiruddha, Now, if you sew it with your supernormal powers, may it quickly be accomplished.

source_sentence: 亦願早成。」
translation: May it also be done sooner.”

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀縫此衣時，其針綖脫，爾時長老摩尼婁陀，獨自唱言：「世間誰樂欲作功德？
translation: When Maṇiruddha sewed this robe, his needle was pierced and removed, and then the elder Maṇiruddha alone called out, Who in the world would want to create merit?

source_sentence: 與我穿針。」
translation: Give me the needle to pierce it.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊獨在房內，攝心坐禪，乃以清淨天耳，聞此摩尼婁陀作如是語。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was alone in his room, concentrating his mind and sitting in meditation, and he heard these words from this Maṇiruddha with the pure divine ear.

source_sentence: 聞是語已，譬如壯士屈申臂頃，即於本處，不現其身，往至長老摩尼婁陀，
translation: When he heard these words, it was as if a strong man had flexed his arm and gone to the elder Maṇiruddha without appearing in his native place.

source_sentence: 住於前已，取針而貫。
translation: After standing in front of him, he takes the needle and penetrates it.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀問言：「是誰為我穿針？」
translation: It was then that the elder Maṇiruddha asked, Who is this man who pierced the needle for me?

source_sentence: 佛告之言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: The Buddha told him, Maṇiruddha!

source_sentence: 是我為汝貫穿針耳。」
translation: I'll pierce your ears with a needle for you.

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸比丘等，傳聞此語云道：「世尊為彼長老摩尼婁陀，以綖穿針。」
translation: At the time, all the monks and others who heard these words said, Bhagavān, for that elder Maṇiruddha, I'll use a needle to pierce a needle.

source_sentence: 既聞此語，各各思惟：「世尊猶尚為彼清淨梵行之人，佐助不辦，況復我等，
translation: Having heard these words, each thought: The World-honored One is still unable to assist those who are engaged in pure and genuine religious practice. How much less could we!

source_sentence: 何故默然不相助也？」
translation: Why are they silent and not assisted by each other?

source_sentence: 因爾已後，諸比丘僧，有所作者，各各相助。
translation: After that, each of the monks and nuns who had authored it assisted the other.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘以此因緣，往詣佛所白言：「世尊！
translation: For this reason, the monks then went to the Buddha and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其彼長老摩尼婁陀，往於昔日種何善業？
translation: What good deeds did that elder Maṇiruddha do in the past?

source_sentence: 今得出家，受具足戒，得羅漢果。
translation: Now that you've left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 世尊復記言：『諸比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān again wrote, 'Monks!

source_sentence: 於我聲聞弟子之中，得淨天眼，最第一者，所謂長老摩尼婁陀比丘是也。』」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the first to attain the pure divine eye is the so-called elderly monk Mañjuśrī, who's the best.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告一切諸比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed all the monks, saying, You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，過去久遠，超於無量阿僧祇劫，有佛出世，名曰然燈如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: “World-honored One, I remember that in the distant past, beyond measureless and incalculable kalpas ago, a buddha named Sūryapradīpa Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Enlightened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Knower of the World, Unsurpassed, Tamer of Humans, Teacher of Devas and Human

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊，為諸比丘，說法之時，種種讚歎天眼之事。
translation: When the Bhagavān explained the teaching to the monks, he praised the divine eye in various ways.

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一居士之子，名曰大財，來集彼會，坐於眾內，聽說其法。
translation: At the time, there was a householder's son named Mahāprajñāpāramitā who came to the assembly and sat inside the congregation to hear his teaching.

source_sentence: 彼居士子，既聽法已，作是思惟：『我今雖復不諮父母捨家出家，我今但可為未來世得天眼故，
translation: Having heard the Dharma, the householder’s son thought: Although I have not advised my parents to leave home and renounce household life, now all I can do is for the sake of attaining divine vision in the future.

source_sentence: 造諸善根。』
translation: They create good roots.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，備辦脂油，得其百斗，於然燈佛無上正真等正覺所，然燈供養，
translation: Having thought thus, he prepared a hundred shengs of grease and oil and offered them to Rāpanna Buddha, the supreme true enlightened one, as an offering of Rāpanna.

source_sentence: 心起是願：『願我來世，值如是佛，彼佛說法，速得證解，於彼世尊聲聞弟子所有天眼，
translation: “Great enlightening beings also make this vow, ‘May I meet such a buddha in the future!

source_sentence: 願我第一。』
translation: May I be the first.'

source_sentence: 又發是願：『生生世世，不墮惡道。』
translation: Again, he gives rise to this vow: 'Birth and birth in the world won't fall into a bad path.'

source_sentence: 爾時，然燈如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，
translation: At that time, however, the Tathāgata Dīpaṅkara, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Enlightened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed, Tamer of Humans, Teacher of Devas and Humans, Buddha, Bhagavat.

source_sentence: 告彼居士子大財言：『於未來世有佛，名曰釋迦牟尼多他伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，
translation: He said to the layman Mahāprajāpatīṇa, “There will be a buddha in the future called Sakyaniṣṭacārita, Arhat, Completely Enlightened.

source_sentence: 十號具足，於彼世尊聲聞弟子，得天眼者，汝當第一。』」
translation: The ten titles are complete, and you'll be the first among those śrāvaka disciples of the Bhagavān who attain the divine eye.'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝等比丘！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, You monks!

source_sentence: 或有心疑，彼時然燈佛邊，大富居士子大財者？
translation: Perhaps there's a mind that doubts, saying, 'That's the great wealthy layman who was at the side of Randana Buddha and the great wealthy man?'

source_sentence: 此即摩尼婁陀是也。」
translation: This is what Maṇiruddha is.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛復告諸比丘作如是言：「我念往昔，久遠之時，有一賊人，於闇夜中，
translation: It was then that the Buddha again addressed the monks in this way: I remember one day, long ago, a long time ago, there was a thief who lived in the darkness of night.

source_sentence: 行在小徑，欲為竊盜，至於半路，其鞋綱斷。
translation: He was walking on a small path, intending to be a thief. Halfway up the road he lost his footwear and legs.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼處有一辟支佛舍利塔，於其塔所，時有一人，然燈求福供養承事，
translation: At the time, there was a tower of the relics of the pratyekabuddha’s relic bones in that place. There was once a man standing at the site of the tower, but Dārṣṭānôttara wished to make merit by honoring and serving him.

source_sentence: 而彼燈油，將欲盡滅。
translation: But the oil of that lamp is about to be completely extinguished.

source_sentence: 其賊至彼，見燈欲盡，為欲續彼斷鞋綱故，遂益其脂，又以箭鏃，挑出燈炷。
translation: When the thief arrived there, he saw that the lamp was about to run out. In order to continue going there, he cut off his footstool and gained some fat. Then he picked out the lamp’s candle by means of an arrow and drew it out.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼燈還得明熾。
translation: At that point, that lamp will again become bright and blazing.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼賊見燈明已，去邊不遠，續彼鞋綱。
translation: At the time, that thief saw the light of the lamp and didn't go far from it, so he resumed his footstool.

source_sentence: 因彼明故，得見彼塔。
translation: Because of their insight, they'll be able to see that stūpa.

source_sentence: 見彼塔已，遂得心淨，得心淨已，發如是願：『此塔是誰？
translation: Seeing that stūpa, he then attained mental purity. Having attained mental purity, he made the following vow:

source_sentence: 願我來世，當值此塔本體世尊，或勝此者，若彼世尊所說之法，願我聞已，
translation: In the future I wish to be able to meet this buddha, the World-honored One, the original essence of the stupa. Or rather, if he is superior to me, then let me hear the Dharma taught by him.

source_sentence: 速得知解，於彼世尊所有聲聞弟子之中，得天眼者，最為第一。
translation: Among the śrāvaka disciples of the Bhagavān, the one who has attained the divine eye is the first.

source_sentence: 又願當來，生生世世，不墮惡道。』」
translation: May I also wish that in the future, birth and birth in the world won't fall into a bad path.'

translation: Sutra of the Collection of the Original Acts of the Buddha, Volume 49
